3855c2f8-3dd3-4ffb-82b1-1b39882b0742.description: Earners of the OpenHack: Containers badge have a fundamental understanding of leveraging Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service to containerize an application and move it to the cloud. They know and have demonstrated the correct application of the principal features of these Azure technologies by preparing a cluster for production.
3855c2f8-3dd3-4ffb-82b1-1b39882b0742.name: OpenHack: Containers

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Containerize an application and move it to the cloud using Azure Kubernetes Service.

38eef8f1-8a53-4a5e-98a3-ec7f5f3e3efd.description: Earners of the OpenHack: DevOps badge have fundamental understanding of the DevOps practices required to achieve zero downtime deployment of containerized micro-services running in Azure. The scenario is a real-world simulation focused on DevOps practices including Continuous Integration, Testing, Delivery, Monitoring and Security. Participants improve delivery velocity and release quality while minimizing downtime using DevOps tools including but not limited to GitHub, Azure DevOps, and Bicep.
38eef8f1-8a53-4a5e-98a3-ec7f5f3e3efd.name: OpenHack: DevOps

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Implement DevOps practices to achieve zero-downtime deployment for a containerized and distributed micro-service based application running in Microsoft Azure.

9194832b-9780-45d4-a9e7-92a0f33b5992.description: Earners of the OpenHack: Cloud-based Data Warehousing badge participated in team based challenges to develop, implement, and operationalize a multi-source data warehouse solution on Microsoft Azure, leveraging technologies such as Azure Data Lake Storage, Data Factory, Databricks, DevOps and Azure Synapse Analytics. They demonstrated application of these technologies to design, build, and deploy architectural components necessary for data consumption required by today's organizations.
9194832b-9780-45d4-a9e7-92a0f33b5992.name: OpenHack: Cloud-based Data Warehousing

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Develop, implement, and operationalize a multi-source data warehouse solution on Microsoft Azure.

4f5a08c7-a6a3-4cc1-95b5-9b17d104047f.description: Earners of the OpenHack: Security, Compliance, and Identity badge have a fundamental understanding of modernized security functions. They know how to apply improvements and ensure policies are enforced in Azure and Microsoft 365. They can utilize monitoring and alerting systems to help protect against threats.
4f5a08c7-a6a3-4cc1-95b5-9b17d104047f.name: OpenHack: Security, Compliance, and Identity

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Identify, assess, and implement security, compliance, and identity related improvements to increase an organization’s protective posture in Microsoft 365 and Azure.

ab8a1d3b-8a3e-4b47-8472-94b857e4305e.description: Earners of the OpenHack: Migration badge understand how to execute an end-to-end migration through optimization. They have shown that they can utilize Azure Migrate to migrate virtual machines to Microsoft Azure and can modernize legacy applications by migrating to PaaS services such as Azure SQL Database and Azure App Service. They have also have a foundational understanding of Azure identity, including hybrid identity with Azure AD and how to leverage Azure RBAC to govern and secure workloads.
ab8a1d3b-8a3e-4b47-8472-94b857e4305e.name: OpenHack: Migrating Microsoft Workloads to Azure

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Migrate on-premise virtual machines to Microsoft Azure using Azure Migrate.

f96933cf-b332-4818-a433-bc6d3b46d91f.description: Earners of the OpenHacks: Serverless badge have a fundamental understanding of how to build and deploy an Azure Serverless solution leveraging technologies such as Azure Functions, Event Grid, and Cosmos DB while working within a team. They have demonstrated the correct application of the principal features of these technologies to build and debug APIs with serverless functions, monitor, manage and deploy a serverless project, and create workflows between systems.
f96933cf-b332-4818-a433-bc6d3b46d91f.name: OpenHack: Serverless

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Build and deploy a Microsoft Azure Serverless solution.

182bb433-0abf-4ab8-85a9-f32a64a3988d.description: Earners of the OpenHack: AI-Powered Knowledge Mining badge have a fundamental understanding of using Microsoft Azure Search and Cognitive Services to build intelligent search solutions. They know and have demonstrated the correct application of the principal features of Microsoft Azure Search, Cognitive Services, and Azure Functions to solve knowledge mining challenges within a team of OpenHack participants.
182bb433-0abf-4ab8-85a9-f32a64a3988d.name: OpenHack: AI-Powered Knowledge Mining

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Implement an Azure Search solution at an AI Powered Knowledge Mining OpenHack.

dc3e8b5e-3596-46d7-a75b-97e795a614fe.description: Earners of the OpenHack: Dynamics 365 + Power Platform badge have a fundamental understanding of leveraging Microsoft Power Platform and Microsoft Azure services to create an end-to-end business application that leverages Microsoft’s Three Cloud Strategy. They know and have demonstrated the correct application of the principal features of these technologies by creating an end-to-end solution that that addresses industry-specific challenges and scenarios.
dc3e8b5e-3596-46d7-a75b-97e795a614fe.name: OpenHack: Dynamics 365 + Power Platform

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Create a Power Apps Canvas App.
Deploy a CDS analytics integration with Power BI.
Azure Active Directory to configure a CDS integration with Microsoft Teams.
Develop an AI Builder model to process forms and create records in CDS.
Create and deploy a managed solution in Dynamics.

dbb23a3d-9d4d-43e0-a967-c6975fa02398.description: Earners of the OpenHack: App Modernization with NoSQL badge have a fundamental understanding of how to migrate a legacy multi-tier application and database to a cloud-based NoSQL environment. They have shown that they can modernize the legacy application using NoSQL and serverless technologies to provide additional business value by optimizing for performance and leveraging a multitude of Azure products and services.
dbb23a3d-9d4d-43e0-a967-c6975fa02398.name: OpenHack: App Modernization with NoSQL

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a part of the Microsoft OpenHack program.
Migrate a legacy database to a cloud-based NoSQL environment.

4183bc93-82fd-4b69-8ba4-0e860215cae6.description: Earners of the OpenHack: DevOps Coach badge have leveraged their expert understanding of how to implement DevOps practices to achieve zero downtime deployment and leadership skills to successfully coach participants through a DevOps OpenHack. They have completed, understood, and explained challenges to a diverse team of customers and Microsoft employees and collected OpenHack and product feedback from participants. They facilitated teamwork, lead team discussions, and unblocked technical issues.
